member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.ColorFormat
member.summary: Defines the ColorFormat component of a GraphicsMode.

remarks.para: A ColorFormat contains Red, Green, Blue and Alpha components that descibe the allocated bits per pixel for the corresponding color.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ColorFormat.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new ColorFormat with the specified aggregate bits per pixel.
member.param: The bits per pixel sum for the Red, Green, Blue and Alpha color channels.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ColorFormat.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new ColorFormat with the specified bits per pixel for the Red, Green, Blue and Alpha color channels.
member.param: Bits per pixel for the Red color channel.
Bits per pixel for the Green color channel.
Bits per pixel for the Blue color channel.
Bits per pixel for the Alpha color channel.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.ColorFormat.Red
member.summary: Gets the bits per pixel for the Red channel.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.ColorFormat.Green
member.summary: Gets the bits per pixel for the Green channel.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.ColorFormat.Blue
member.summary: Gets the bits per pixel for the Blue channel.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.ColorFormat.Alpha
member.summary: Gets the bits per pixel for the Alpha channel.

member.summary: Gets a System.Boolean indicating whether this ColorFormat is indexed.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.ColorFormat.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Gets the sum of Red, Green, Blue and Alpha bits per pixel.

member.summary: Converts the specified bpp into a new ColorFormat.

member.returns: A ColorFormat with the specified bits per pixel.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsBindingsBase
member.summary: Implements BindingsBase for the OpenTK.Graphics namespace (OpenGL and OpenGL|ES).

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsBindingsBase.GetAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an unmanaged function pointer to the specified function.
member.param: A that defines the name of the function.
member.returns: A that contains the address of funcname or IntPtr.Zero, if the function is not supported by the drivers.
member.remarks: Note: some drivers are known to return non-zero values for unsupported functions. Typical values include 1 and 2 - inheritors are advised to check for and ignore these values.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext
member.summary: Represents and provides methods to manipulate an OpenGL render context.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.#ctor(OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsMode,OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo)
member.summary: Constructs a new GraphicsContext with the specified GraphicsMode and attaches it to the specified window.
member.param: The OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo to attach the GraphicsContext to.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.#ctor(OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsMode,OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContextFlags)
member.summary: Constructs a new GraphicsContext with the specified GraphicsMode, version and flags, and attaches it to the specified window.
member.param: The OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo to attach the GraphicsContext to.
The major version of the new GraphicsContext.
The minor version of the new GraphicsContext.
member.remarks: Different hardware supports different flags, major and minor versions. Invalid parameters will be silently ignored.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.#ctor(OpenTK.ContextHandle,OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo)
member.summary: Constructs a new GraphicsContext from a pre-existing context created outside of OpenTK.
member.param: The handle of the existing context. This must be a valid, unique handle that is not known to OpenTK.
The window this context is bound to. This must be a valid window obtained through Utilities.CreateWindowInfo.
member.exception: Occurs if handle is identical to a context already registered with OpenTK.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.#ctor(OpenTK.ContextHandle,OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo,OpenTK.Graphics.IGraphicsContext,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContextFlags)
member.summary: Constructs a new GraphicsContext from a pre-existing context created outside of OpenTK.
member.param: The handle of the existing context. This must be a valid, unique handle that is not known to OpenTK.
The window this context is bound to. This must be a valid window obtained through Utilities.CreateWindowInfo.
A different context that shares resources with this instance, if any. Pass null if the context is not shared or if this is the first GraphicsContext instruct you construct.
The major version of the context (e.g. "2" for "2.1").
The minor version of the context (e.g. "1" for "2.1").
A bitwise combination of that describe this context.
member.exception: Occurs if handle is identical to a context already registered with OpenTK.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.ToString
member.summary: Returns a representing this instance.
member.returns: A that contains a string representation of this instance.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A System.Int32 with the hash code of this instance.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares two instances.
member.returns: True, if obj is equal to this instance; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.CreateDummyContext
member.summary: Creates a dummy GraphicsContext to allow OpenTK to work with contexts created by external libraries.

remarks.para: Instances created by this method will not be functional. Instance methods will have no effect.
This method requires that a context is current on the calling thread.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.CreateDummyContext(OpenTK.ContextHandle)
member.summary: Creates a dummy GraphicsContext to allow OpenTK to work with contexts created by external libraries.

remarks.para: Instances created by this method will not be functional. Instance methods will have no effect.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.Assert
member.summary: Checks if a GraphicsContext exists in the calling thread and throws a GraphicsContextMissingException if it doesn't.
member.exception: Generated when no GraphicsContext is current in the calling thread.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.CurrentContext
member.summary: Gets the GraphicsContext that is current in the calling thread.
member.remarks: Note: this property will not function correctly when both desktop and EGL contexts are available in the same process. This scenario is very unlikely to appear in practice.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.ShareContexts
member.summary: Gets or sets a System.Boolean, indicating whether GraphicsContext resources are shared

remarks.para: If ShareContexts is true, new GLContexts will share resources. If this value is false, new GLContexts will not share resources.
Changing this value will not affect already created GLContexts.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.DirectRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets a System.Boolean, indicating whether GraphicsContexts will perform direct rendering.

remarks.para: If DirectRendering is true, new contexts will be constructed with direct rendering capabilities, if possible. If DirectRendering is false, new contexts will be constructed with indirect rendering capabilities.
This property does not affect existing GraphicsContexts, unless they are recreated.
This property is ignored on Operating Systems without support for indirect rendering, like Windows and OS X.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.ErrorChecking
member.summary: Gets or sets a System.Boolean, indicating whether automatic error checking should be performed. Influences the debug version of OpenTK.dll, only.
member.remarks: Automatic error checking will clear the OpenGL error state. Set CheckErrors to false if you use the OpenGL error state in your code flow (e.g. for checking supported texture formats).

members.member:
Creates an OpenGL context with the specified direct/indirect rendering mode and sharing state with the specified IGraphicsContext.
Set to true for direct rendering or false otherwise. The source IGraphicsContext to share state from..
Direct rendering is the default rendering mode for OpenTK, since it can provide higher performance in some circumastances.
The 'direct' parameter is a hint, and will ignored if the specified mode is not supported (e.g. setting indirect rendering on Windows platforms).

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.SwapBuffers
member.summary: Swaps buffers on a context. This presents the rendered scene to the user.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.MakeCurrent(OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo)
member.summary: Makes the GraphicsContext the current rendering target.
member.remarks: You can use this method to bind the GraphicsContext to a different window than the one it was created from.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.IsCurrent
member.summary: Gets a indicating whether this instance is current in the calling thread.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets a indicating whether this instance has been disposed. It is an error to access any instance methods if this property returns true.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.VSync
member.summary: [obsolete] Use SwapInterval property instead. Gets or sets a value indicating whether VSync is enabled. When VSync is enabled, calls will be synced to the refresh rate of the that contains improving visual quality and reducing CPU usage. However, systems that cannot maintain the requested rendering rate will suffer from large jumps in performance. This can be counteracted by increasing the value.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.SwapInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a positive integer in the range [1, n), indicating the number of refreshes between consecutive calls. The maximum value for n is implementation-dependent. The default value is 1. This value will only affect instances where is enabled. Invalid values will be clamped to the valid range.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContext.Update(OpenTK.Platform.IWindowInfo)
member.summary: Updates the graphics context. This must be called when the render target is resized for proper behavior on Mac OS X.

member.summary: Loads all OpenGL entry points.
member.exception: Occurs when this instance is not current on the calling thread.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Platform.Utilities.LoadExtensions(System.Type)
member.summary: Loads all extensions for the specified class. This function is intended for OpenGL, Wgl, Glx, OpenAL etc.
member.param: The class to load extensions for.

remarks.para: The Type must contain a nested class called "Delegates".
The Type must also implement a static function called LoadDelegate with the following signature: static Delegate LoadDelegate(string name, Type signature)
This function allocates memory.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Input.KeyboardDevice.KeyRepeat
member.summary: Gets or sets a System.Boolean indicating key repeat status.
member.remarks:
If KeyRepeat is true, multiple KeyDown events will be generated while a key is being held. Otherwise only one KeyDown event will be reported.
The rate of the generated KeyDown events is controlled by the Operating System. Usually, one KeyDown event will be reported, followed by a small (250-1000ms) pause and several more KeyDown events (6-30 events per second).
Set to true to handle text input (where keyboard repeat is desirable), but set to false for game input.

member.remarks: This value defines whether the curve should be calculated as a parallel curve to the original bezier curve. A value of 0.0f represents the original curve, 5.0f i.e. stands for a curve that has always a distance of 5.0f to the orignal curve at any point.

remarks.para: The precision gets better as the value gets smaller.

The parameter defines whether the curve should be calculated as a parallel curve to the original bezier curve. A value of 0.0f represents the original curve, 5.0f represents a curve that has always a distance of 5.0f to the orignal curve.

member.param: The t parameter, a value between 0.0f and 1.0f.
member.remarks: The parameter defines whether the curve should be calculated as a parallel curve to the original bezier curve. A value of 0.0f represents the original curve, 5.0f represents a curve that has always a distance of 5.0f to the orignal curve.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Half
member.summary: The name Half is derived from half-precision floating-point number. It occupies only 16 bits, which are split into 1 Sign bit, 5 Exponent bits and 10 Mantissa bits.
member.remarks: Quote from ARB_half_float_pixel specification: Any representable 16-bit floating-point value is legal as input to a GL command that accepts 16-bit floating-point data. The result of providing a value that is not a floating-point number (such as infinity or NaN) to such a command is unspecified, but must not lead to GL interruption or termination. Providing a denormalized number or negative zero to GL must yield predictable results.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Half.Equals(OpenTK.Half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this instance is equal to a specified OpenTK.Half value.
member.param: OpenTK.Half object to compare to this instance..
member.returns: True, if other is equal to this instance; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Half.CompareTo(OpenTK.Half)
member.summary: Compares this instance to a specified half-precision floating-point number and returns an integer that indicates whether the value of this instance is less than, equal to, or greater than the value of the specified half-precision floating-point number.
member.param: A half-precision floating-point number to compare.
member.returns:
A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and value. If the number is:
Less than zero, then this instance is less than other, or this instance is not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN) and other is a number.
Zero: this instance is equal to value, or both this instance and other are not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN), OpenTK.Half.PositiveInfinity, or OpenTK.Half.NegativeInfinity.
Greater than zero: this instance is greater than othrs, or this instance is a number and other is not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN).

member.summary: Returns an approximation of the inverse square root of left number.
member.returns: An approximation of the inverse square root of the specified number, with an upper error bound of 0.001
member.remarks: This is an improved implementation of the the method known as Carmack's inverse square root which is found in the Quake III source code. This implementation comes from http://www.codemaestro.com/reviews/review00000105.html. For the history of this method, see http://www.beyond3d.com/content/articles/8/

and , invoke

member.name: M:OpenTK.GameViewBase.OnUnload(System.EventArgs)
member.param: An that contains the event data.
member.summary:
Raises the
event.

remarks.para: The OnUnload method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
remarks.block: When overriding OnUnload in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's OnUnload method so that registered delegates receive the event.

of the following frame; everything is executed as quickly as possible. This may not be desirable.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Toolkit
member.summary: Provides static methods to manage an OpenTK application.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Toolkit.Init
member.summary: Initializes OpenTK. This method is necessary only if you are using OpenTK alongside a different windowing toolkit (e.g. GTK#) and should be the very first method called by your application (i.e. calling this method should be the very first statement executed by the "Main" method).
member.remarks: Some windowing toolkits do not configure the underlying platform correctly or configure it in a way that is incompatible with OpenTK. Calling this method first ensures that OpenTK is given the chance to initialize itself and configure the platform correctly.

member.name: T:OpenTK.WindowBorder
member.summary: Enumerates available window borders.

member.name: F:OpenTK.WindowBorder.Resizable
member.summary: The window has a resizable border. A window with a resizable border can be resized by the user or programmatically.

member.name: F:OpenTK.WindowBorder.Fixed
member.summary: The window has a fixed border. A window with a fixed border can only be resized programmatically.

member.name: F:OpenTK.WindowBorder.Hidden
member.summary: The window does not have a border. A window with a hidden border can only be resized programmatically.

member.name: T:OpenTK.WindowState
member.summary: Enumerates available window states.

member.name: F:OpenTK.WindowState.Normal
member.summary: The window is in its normal state.

member.name: F:OpenTK.WindowState.Minimized
member.summary: The window is minimized to the taskbar (also known as 'iconified').

member.name: F:OpenTK.WindowState.Maximized
member.summary: The window covers the whole working area, which includes the desktop but not the taskbar and/or panels.

member.name: F:OpenTK.WindowState.Fullscreen
member.summary: The window covers the whole screen, including all taskbars and/or panels.
